International Workshop "Access to Genetic Resources and Sharing Benefits Arising from Their Utilization (ABS)" (Switzerland, 2011) http://www.icsu.org/events/ICSU%20Events/abs-workshop This workshop was concerned with the freedom and responsibility of individual scientists and the world scientific community with respect to access to genetic resources and sharing of benefits arising from their use, as regulated in the Access and Benefit Sharing (ABS) System, which is part of the Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD, 1992). Workshop programme (PDF)

Synopsis

The discussions revealed the need to find a balance between the important question of responsibility and the global issue of equity. At the same time, and because scientists must be in a position to work without unnecessary impediments, the discussions included concerns about access to genetic and other biological material because access procedures might create research constraints.

Presentations

  • The ABS regime: rationale, elements, legal basis, state of affairs
    Marco D'Alessandro, Scientific Collaborator, Section Biotechnology, Swiss Federal Office for the Environment (PDF)
  • Viewpoints of users
    Laurent Gautier, Conservator, Botanical Gardens, City of Geneva (PDF)
    Esther Schelling, Scientist, Swiss Tropical and Public Health Institute (PDF)
  • Viewpoints from provider countries
    Neil Crouch, Head Ethnobotany Unit & Deputy Director Research, South African National
    Biodiversity Institute (PDF)
    Perry S. Ong, Director, Institute of Biology, University of the Philippines, Diliman (PDF)
    Mahabir P. Gupta, Director, Center for Pharmacognostic on Panamanian Flora, University of
    Panam\ufffd\ufffd, and Member, ICSU Regional Committee for Latin America and the Caribbean (PDF)
  • Responsibilities of stakeholders in academic research
    Susette Biber-Klemm, ABS Project Coordinator, Swiss Academy of Sciences (PDF)
    Peter J. Edwards, Head, Institute of Integrative Biology, ETH Zurich (PDF)
  • Responsibilities of organisations in international processes
    Timothy J. Hodges, former Co-Chair, Convention on Biological Diversity ABS Working Group (PDF)
    Anne-H\ufffd\ufffdl\ufffd\ufffdne Prieur Richard, Deputy Director, DIVERSITAS (PDF)
    Nathalie Fomproix, Executive Director, International Union of Biological Sciences (PDF)

Organisers and hosts

The workshop was organised and hosted by the Swiss Academy of Sciences (SCNAT), whose Biodiversity Forum has been concerned with the issue of Access and Benefit Sharing for several years,\ufffd\ufffdin consultation with the ICSU Committee on Freedom and Responsibility in the conduct of Science (CFRS). The overseas speakers joined the workshop through teleconference and/or Skype.
